Package org.dyn4j.collision

Package containing classes to detect collisions between Convex Shapes.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Bounds
    Represents the Bounds of the simulation/world.
    BoundsListener
    Represents an object that is notified when a Collidable goes out of Bounds.
    Collidable
    Represents an object that can collide with other objects.
    Filter
    Interface representing a filter for collision detection.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractBounds
    Abstract implementation of the Bounds interface.
    AxisAlignedBounds
    Represents a bounding region that is an Axis-Aligned bounding box.
    BoundsAdapter
    Convenience class for implementing the BoundsListener interface.
    CategoryFilter
    Filter for categorized objects.
    Collisions
    Class used to estimate collision counts and other one-off collision tasks.
    Fixture
    Represents a part of a Collidable.
    RectangularBounds Deprecated
    replaced with AxisAlignedBounds in 3.1.1
    TypeFilter
    Represents a class typed filter.

Package org.dyn4j.collision Description

Package containing classes to detect collisions between Convex Shapes.

Collision detection can be an expensive process. To avoid unnecessary processing a two phase approach to collision detection is used. First a inaccurate, yet conservative, algorithm is used to detect possible collision pairs. This process is called the broad-phase. Next, after obtaining all the possible collision pairs, each pair is tested using an accurate algorithm. This is called the narrow-phase.

Broad-phase

The BroadphaseDetectors will determine whether two Convex Shapes can possibly penetrate, returning only valid BroadphasePairs, which should then be sent to a NarrowphaseDetector.

Narrow-phase

The NarrowphaseDetectors will determine whether two Convex Shapes penetrate and return a Penetration.

A Penetration object represents the minimum distance along some vector required to push the Shapes out of the penetration.

Manifold Generation

Once a Penetration object is obtained, it should be passed to a ManifoldSolver. A ManifoldSolver will use the Penetration object and the given Convex Shapes to create a collision Manifold.

A collision Manifold represents the collision points between the two Convex Shapes.

The following is a list of implementations of the above interfaces:

  • BroadphaseDetectors
    • SapIncremental
    • SapBruteForce
    • SapTree
    • DynamicAABBTree
  • NarrowphaseDetector
    • Gjk
    • Sat
  • ManifoldSolver
    • ClippingManifoldSolver
Since:
1.0.0
Version:
3.0.0
Author:
William Bittle
